means: （刺猬或豪猪的）刺( quill的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Quills were the chief writing implement from the 6 th century AD until the advent of steel pens in the mid 19 th century.
sentence.Network_cn: 从公元6世纪到19世纪中期钢笔出现以前,羽毛笔是主要的书写工具.

sentence.Network_en: Defensive quills dot the backs of these troublesome creatures.
sentence.Network_cn: 防御性的刺长在这些讨人厌的生物背上.

sentence.Network_en: And oh ye high flown quills that soar the skies.
sentence.Network_cn: 啊,翱翔蓝天展翅高飞的羽翼.

entry.def: A quill is a pen made from a bird's feather.

example.ex: She dipped a quill in ink, then began to write.
example.tran: 她将羽毛笔在墨水里蘸了一下，随后开始书写。

entry.def: A bird's quills are large, stiff feathers on its wings and tail.
The quills of a porcupine are the long sharp points on its body.

auth_sentence.content: He wrote with quills and a simple fountain pen.
auth_sentence.res_content: He wrote with quills and a simple fountain pen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He wrote with quills and a simple fountain pen.

auth_sentence.content: The magnificent bird of paradise has two tail quills and three capes on his shoulder.
auth_sentence.res_content: The magnificent bird of paradise has two tail quills and three capes on his shoulder.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The magnificent bird of paradise has two tail quills and three capes on his shoulder.

auth_sentence.content: The various types of six-wired bird have quills on their heads, and clear areas of the forest floor to dance on.
auth_sentence.res_content: The various types of six-wired bird have quills on their heads, and clear areas of the forest floor to dance on.
